executive_summary: Over the five years to 2021, demand for the Hardware Store Franchises industry has experienced significant growth amid positive trends within consumer spending and residential construction projects. Overall, IBISWorld expects industry revenue to increase at an annualized rate of 5.2% to $7.4 billion over the five years to 2021, including an increase of 4.8% in 2021 alone. Similarly, industry profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to increase during the same period, accounting for 3.9% of revenue in 2021, up from 3.3% in 2016.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry revenue has increased at an annualized rate of 5.2% to $7.4 billion over the five years to 2021, including an increase of 4.8% in 2021 alone.
Industry profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to account for 3.9% of revenue in 2021, up from 3.3% in 2016.
Industry revenue increased 11.5% in 2020 alone due to increased demand for DIY projects and residential construction amid the pandemic.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: IBISWorld forecasts industry revenue to increase an annualized 1.0% to $7.8 billion over the five years to 2026.
Industry profit is expected to decline slightly, accounting for 3.8% of revenue in 2026, down from 3.9% in 2021.
Big-box retailers, department stores and e-commerce will continue posing competitive pressure on industry operators.

industry_definition: Franchises in this industry retail a range of home renovation equipment and supplies, including hardware, plumbing, electrical and paint-related products, among others. Reports in our Business Franchise collection focus solely on the operation of franchised outlets and exclude nonfranchise data and data for cooperatives (co-ops). Figures represented in this report reflect the total number of franchise outlets, total revenue and the average profit margin earned by franchisees.
key_trends: Franchise agreements offer potential operators preestablished buying power
Households' demand for industry products has remained strong
New entrants have generated growth in the industry labor force
Industry revenue is expected to grow at a slower rate during the outlook period
Industry operators have taken advantage of e-commerce platforms to generate sales
New entrants are expected to attempt to capture market share in a highly fragmented industry
The unique nature of the pandemic has benefited the industry

market_segmentation.segment_description: In the Hardware Store Franchises industry, household consumers generate the largest share of industry revenue, accounting for 59.8% of revenue in 2021. Household consumers purchase industry products from hardware stores primarily for home improvement projects. This segment has decreased slightly as a share of revenue over the five years to 2021, as a result of growth in other segments and not decreased demand from households.

Businesses are expected to generate 18.2% of industry revenue in 2021. The businesses segment primarily includes industrial users of industry products for production and repair services. Additionally, this segment includes professional service business offices and agriculture farmers. This market typically purchases repair tools and lawn and garden supplies to repair and maintain property issues that can be fixed without the use of a professional contractor.

Contractors are expected to generate 12.9% of industry revenue in 2021. This segment primarily includes smaller contractors that perform residential construction projects, as most contractors tend to purchase goods from larger wholesalers. Therefore, this segment has experienced growth during the period, as the value of residential construction has increased at an annualized rate of 4.1% over the five years to 2021.
All other markets account for an estimated 6.7% of revenue in 2021.
Government entities account for 2.4% of revenue in 2021, decreasing slightly as a share of revenue over the past five years.

products_and_services.product_description: In the Hardware Store Franchises industry, hardware tools and products are expected to account for the largest share of revenue, accounting for at 34.9% in 2021. Private spending on home improvements has risen at an annualized rate of 4.9% over the five years to 2021, boosting demand for hardware tools and products from this segment. As the popularity of do-it-yourself (DIY) projects rises, revenue generated by this segment has increased accordingly.

Power tools and equipment are expected to account for 5.8% of revenue in 2021. This segment primarily includes products used for cutting or deconstructing during construction projects. As technological advances enabled consumer and users to use power tools and equipment for more tasks, this segment has continued to experience consistent demand over the past five years. Additionally, this segment has benefited from increased private spending on home improvements during the period, as sales from this segment are generated from both individual consumers and professional contractors.

Dimensional lumber is expected to account for 0.2% of industry revenue in 2021. This segment includes plywood, boards and treated lumber for construction projects. However, this segment has been constrained as a share of revenue over the five years to 2021, primarily as a result of increased external competition from lumber wholesalers, lumber and building material stores, as well as home improvement stores.

Paint and sundries are expected to account for 8.1% of industry revenue in 2020. Products in this segment include interior and exterior paints, coatings and stains. As the dimensional lumber product segment has been negatively affected by external competition over the past five years, so too has the pain Although home improvement stores and paint stores offer similar paint products, industry operators have generated consistent revenue from this segment over the past five years.

Plumbing fixtures and supplies are expected to account for 6.6% of industry revenue in 2021. This segment has increased as a share of revenue over the past five years, primarily as a result of an increase in the value of residential construction.

Hand tools and accessories are expected to account for 6.5% of industry revenue in 2021. This segment includes the sale of cutting blades and bits. This segment's share of industry revenue has increased over the past five years in line with revenue.

All other products account for 33.4% of industry revenue in 2021. This segment includes other merchandise, such as doors, flooring, roofing and household supplies. As hardware stores attempt to differentiate from home improvement stores and the products sold, this segment has risen as a share of revenue over the past five years.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand depends on broad macroeconomic factors like per capita disposable income, consumer confidence and spending. During positive economic conditions with low unemployment and high disposable income, consumers feel more confident to spend on home improvements.

Low interest rates enable consumers to have more disposable income to spend on home improvements instead of mortgage payments or loans. High interest rates reduce disposable income available for discretionary spending.

As DIY projects become more popular, demand increases for hardware tools and products needed to complete these projects. The COVID-19 pandemic caused a significant rise in DIY projects in 2020 due to stay-at-home orders.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Hardware Store Franchises industry describes domestically based, franchised retail establishments, and therefore, does not engage in international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is expected to have the largest share of industry establishments at 24.6% in 2021. This relatively high share corresponds to the region's population share of 25.8% in the same year.
The Great Lakes region accounts for 17.0% of industry establishments in 2021, primarily due to the region's high population share and booming housing market.

In 2021, the Mid-Atlantic region is expected to account for 14.5% of industry establishments, while accounting for 15.0% of the population. This region includes New York, which accounts for 7.0% of establishments in 2021.

The West region is expected to account for 13.4% of industry establishments in 2021. California accounts for 8.2% of industry establishments in 2021, making it the largest state by establishment count in the United States.
The New England region is expected to account for 4.1% of industry establishments in 2021.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Operators must comply with antitrust laws like the Sherman, Clayton and Robinson-Patman Acts to ensure fair competition.
Operators must comply with laws like the Federal Consumer Credit Protection Act regarding lending and financing.
Operators must comply with the Fair Labor Standards Act regarding minimum wage and working conditions.
Operators had to comply with social distancing guidelines and provide health and safety measures during the pandemic.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators compete internally on the basis of price, as operators tend to offer deals for industry products.
Companies with locations near downstream markets tend to perform best, as it limits the distance household consumers must travel to purchase industry products.
Operators compete through the range of products offered.
As a franchising industry, brand-name recognition is of particular importance.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is relatively fragmented and dominated by smaller companies in regional and local markets.
Large companies like Ace Hardware are excluded from being considered industry-relevant due to the cooperative nature of franchise operations.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage expenses represent the second-largest cost category after purchases, forecast to account for 15.5% of revenue in 2021.
Purchase costs represent the largest expense category, relating to operating inventory. Larger operators have more negotiating power with wholesalers.
Rent expenses are expected to account for 1.5% of revenue in 2021, varying based on store location and size.
Marketing expenses forecast at 0.9% of revenue in 2021, benefiting from established franchise brand image and marketing materials.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Initial capital requirements differ depending on the size and scale of an establishment, but expenditures are typically allocated toward retail locations, sales tracking systems and machinery for transporting larger items.
The capital-to-labor ratio is expected to be $0.07 on capital expenditures for every $1.00 spent on labor in 2021, indicating low capital intensity.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue volatility is influenced by economic trends like consumer spending and construction activity.
The industry experienced a large revenue increase in 2020 due to increased home improvement spending during the pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Electronic inventory tracking systems have aided in reducing purchase expenses by balancing stock with demand.
Online retailers like Amazon offer industry products and can undercut prices, disrupting industry demand.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a particular market or product category or operate as a general hardware retailer?
FAQs.answer: Hardware stores sell a variety of consumer products, such as power and hand tools, paint, plumbing supplies and electrical equipment.

FAQs.question: Do your sales trends generally follow trends within the domestic economy?
FAQs.answer: Industry demand is largely dependent on economic factors influencing disposable income levels and private investment in home improvement projects. Despite poor economic conditions, the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic caused overall growth in the industry due to increased do-it-yourself home improvements.

FAQs.question: Are your product sales heavily dependent on wealthy or low income consumers?
FAQs.answer: Hardware store franchises typically market products of varying price ranges to capture consumers from all income brackets. Realizing a concentration in one area may present opportunities in attracting consumers of differing financial situations.

FAQs.question: Does your company maintain health relationships with suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Franchises often purchase inventory from parent affiliate companies. Proximity to supplier distribution networks could potentially reduce transportation costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored potential acquisition opportunities to generate growth?
FAQs.answer: Acquisition activity can provide penetration into previously untapped regional markets.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems for monitoring inventory levels?
FAQs.answer: Adequate inventory for popular products is crucial in generating recurring revenue. Analysis of sales trends can provide insight on potential seasonal fluctuations in demand, enabling proper inventory management.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage expenses using automation and computer systems in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Various digital systems regarding inventory tracking, sales volume and average order size increase efficiency and reduce total required staff to operate a hardware store franchise.

FAQs.question: Is your company effectively prepared to adjust to changing environmental regulations?
FAQs.answer: Recent focus on sustainability has become a key factor in influencing consumer purchase decisions. Providing environmentally conscious products may attract new customers.

FAQs.question: Does your company remain compliant with current consumer regulation?
FAQs.answer: Companies, especially franchises, must comply with industry regulation as well as guidelines laid out by the franchising parent company. The coronavirus increased regulations such as social distancing, mask mandates and increased cleaning and sanitation procedures.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality in revenue?
FAQs.answer: Certain product categories, such as garden and lawn supplies, experience demand fluctuations based on seasons. Hardware store franchises typically over consultation and other services to smooth revenue trends.

FAQs.question: What ongoing financial challenges does your company contend with?
FAQs.answer: As a retail industry, inventory purchases represent the largest expenses category for hardware store franchises.

FAQs.question: Is your company within a reasonable proximity to key suppliers? How can you distribute resources effectively?
FAQs.answer: Franchisers must be able to distribute resources and relevant inventory to franchisees. Proximity to suppliers influences total purchase expenses in regards to transportation costs. Supply chain issues caused by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic have increased the importance of having good relationships with suppliers.

FAQs.question: What are the start-up costs involved for franchising one of your businesses? How many franchise operations are currently in business?
FAQs.answer: As a franchise industry, the ability to franchise operations is a key success factor.

FAQs.question: What systems does your company have in place in regards to inventory management and sales tracking? Do you have plans to invest in new systems to control stock?
FAQs.answer: Computer systems, such as point-of-sale (POS) tracking provide critical data on popular products and demand cycles. Using electronic inventory management systems can aid in reducing wasted shelf space with unpopular products.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor fluctuations in disposable income? How has increased disposable income affected you?
FAQs.answer: Per capita disposable income varies between different geographic locations. Understanding local fluctuations in disposable income levels aids in appropriately pricing industry products relative to local consumer markets.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor mortgage rates? How can you position your business to succeed even when borrowing costs are high?
FAQs.answer: As a retail industry primarily engaged in selling home improvement equipment and supplies, demand for hardware store franchises is influenced by fluctuation in mortgage rates.

FAQs.question: How has the current level of private spending on home improvements affected your company? How can you adapt as private spending declines?
FAQs.answer: Households represent the largest industry market segment. Thus, private spending on home improvement projects reflects the propensity for consumers to invest in remodeling, renovations and additions.
